channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: If Kimmel Apologist David French Cared About ‘Free Speech,’ He Wouldn’t Have Helped Censor Conservatives
item.description: If French actually cared about free speech, he would have opposed the mass censorship of conservatives. Instead, he supported it.

item.title: The Government Shouldn’t Police Jimmy Kimmel’s Lies
item.description: ABC and its affiliates may have pulled the trigger, but they did so with FCC guns pointed at their own heads if they did not.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg blames bad Wi-Fi after the live demo of his new $800 smart glasses goes horribly wrong
item.description: Critics are raving about Meta's new wearables. But Zuckerberg’s live demo of the $799 Ray-Ban Display was a pretty big flop.

item.title: So Now the Left Is Against Government Extortion to Suppress Speech?
item.description: Congratulations, Democrats. You’re now living in the world you created.

item.title: Of Course the FCC Is Abusing Its Power over Broadcasting
item.description: It has done so before, and so long as it retains its power, it will do it again.

item.title: Senate moves to declare conservative icon's birthday as the 'National Day of Remembrance for Charlie Kirk'

item.title: A Visit to the University of Texas’s Art Museum in Austin
item.description: A nice place, but someone should explain what ‘extraction’ means to the wealth of the nation and people’s paychecks.
